Unfortunately, I think we can count on seeing a Hillary/Obama ticket from the dems. With as many dupes and vote-for-a-living people we have here, they'll be hard to beat.

 
 Personally, my prediction is that in the end neither Hillary NOR Obama will get the nomination. The DNC isn't stupid; they're not going to risk running a minority or a woman when nothing other than white men have ever made it to the presidency in the past. 'Electability' will win out in the end. I think you'll be seeing a John Edwards nomination, and I think DNC leaders like Dean are secretly rooting for Edwards because they know than when the general election happens, that's who would have the best chance. There will be some controversy over it and the DNC won't want to admit their reasons for it. But that's my prediction. I'm not saying that it should be that way, but rather that it will be. That's the unfortunate reality of American politics. 
 
 Of course I could be wrong and the DNC may go out on a big limb doing something new this time around, and she (or Obama) get the Democratic nomination, but if they did I just don't think they'd get elected. However, I can pretty much guarantee you that they both won't be on the ticket, one as a running mate to the other. If anything, Hillary or Obama would pick Edwards as a running mate to appeal to white males and/or southerners. The advantage of being a white male in American politics is still too strong, and winning candidates tend to come from the south or mid-west. If the Republicans run someone like Fred Thompson against a Hillary/Obama ticket, they'd mop the floor with them.

 I can't listen to her for more than 30 seconds. Not because of the content of what she says, but because her voice is very annoying to me. Seriously. It has this obnoxious blaring quality to it when I hear her speak publicly. I'm not sure why--I think she tries to sound more masculine or something since she's the only woman in a race dominated by alpha-male candidates. And it just doesn't work, IMO. It's a known fact she changes her voice depending on the situation, as Youtube videos demonstrate her switching to a southern drawl when speaking to southern rural audiences and trying to emulate a slightly "ebonics"-sort of voice when speaking to black churches.
 
 FWIW, W has an annoying speaking voice too. I don't like listening to him for long periods of time, but Hilary Clinton's voice annoys me even more. It's been a very long time since we've had a really good and powerful public speaker as a president. I guess Reagan was the last one we had. Bill Clinton was at least not annoying like Bush and Hillary, but I'd call him average in terms of delivery.
